meanings.definition: Test taken again to assess knowledge or ability.
meanings.sent1: After failing the math retest, she studied harder for the next one.
meanings.sent2: The teacher scheduled a retest for the students who missed the first one.
meanings.sent3: The retest turned into a friendly competition among classmates.
meanings.sent4: Taking the retest felt like a second chance to prove her understanding.
meanings.sent5: The retest results showed improvement in the students' comprehension.

meanings.definition: To take a test again to improve a score.
meanings.sent1: He decided to retest his knowledge of Spanish before the final exam.
meanings.sent2: She will retest the driving exam to get her license.
meanings.sent3: The students groaned at the thought of having to retest the difficult quiz.
meanings.sent4: Retesting the experiment confirmed the initial findings.
meanings.sent5: The athlete will retest his speed to beat his previous record.

meanings.definition: To administer a test again to a group of individuals.
meanings.sent1: The professor had to retest the entire class due to a technical error.
meanings.sent2: The school decided to retest all the students to ensure fairness.
meanings.sent3: The retesting process required additional resources and time.
meanings.sent4: Retesting the employees helped identify areas for improvement.
meanings.sent5: The company will retest the new software to check for any bugs.
